005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.databind.model.metaschema;
007
008import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.datatype.markup.MarkupLine;
009import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.model.constraint.IConstraint;
010import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.databind.model.metaschema.binding.Property;
011import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.databind.model.metaschema.binding.Remarks;
012
013import java.util.List;
014
015import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.Nullable;
016
017/**
018 * Represents constraint metadata that is common to all constraints.
019 */
020public interface IConstraintBase {
021
022  /**
023   * Get the assigned identifier for the constraint.
024   * <p>
025   * This identifier is useful for to support references to the constraint.
026   *
027   * @return the identifier or {@code null} if no identifier is assigned
028   */
029  @Nullable
030  String getId();
031
032  /**
033   * Get the assigned formal name for the constraint.
034   * <p>
035   * This name is useful for understanding the intent of the constraint.
036   *
037   * @return the formal name or {@code null} if no formal name is assigned
038   */
039  @Nullable
040  String getFormalName();
041
042  /**
043   * Get a description of what the constraint does.
044   * <p>
045   * This description is useful for understanding the intent of the constraint.
046   *
047   * @return the description or {@code null} if no description is provided
048   */
049  @Nullable
050  MarkupLine getDescription();
051
052  /**
053   * Get an optional collection of properties assigned to the constraint.
054   * <p>
055   * A property provides a means to assign various characteristics to a
056   * constraint.
057   *
058   * @return the properties or {@code null} if no properties are provided
059   */
060  @Nullable
061  List<Property> getProps();
062
063  /**
064   * Get the optional remarks that provide additional details explanation the
065   * intent or use of the constraint.
066   * <p>
067   * Use of remarks can provide additional insights into why a constraint exists
068   * or why the constraint was implemented in this way.
069   *
070   * @return the remarks or {@code null} if no remarks are provided
071   */
072  @Nullable
073  Remarks getRemarks();
074
075  /**
076   * Get the requested level to report if the constraint is not satisfied.
077   * <p>
078   * If not provided, then the default level provided by
079   * {@link IConstraint#DEFAULT_LEVEL} is used.
080   *
081   * @return the level or {@code null} if the default level is to be used
082   */
083  @Nullable
084  String getLevel();
085}
